item.title: Internal Talking Points: Romney Will Push His 'Own' Budget Proposal,Not Paul Ryan's Plan
item.description: "They aren't going to have the same view on every issue," Romney talking points on Ryan note http://t.co/FGXjPviR
item.content:encoded: "They aren't going to have the same view on every issue," Romney talking points on Ryan note http://t.co/FGXjPviR ABC News’ Michael Falcone reports: NORFOLK, Va. — Does Mitt Romney’s selection of Paul Ryan as his running mate mean that the former Massachusetts governor will embrace the Wisconsin congressman’s budget plan? Not exactly, according to a set of internal talking points produced by the Romney campaign and obtained by ABC News. “Gov. Romney applauds Paul Ryan for going in the right direction with his budget,” according to the talking points, “and as president he will be putting together his own plan for cutting the deficit and putting the budget on a path to balance.” The memo includes responses to… Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: abcnews.go.com

item.title: Paul Ryan Sponsored Fetal Personhood Bill, Opposes Family Planning Funds
item.description: http://t.co/VzYXkXoF Paul Ryan Sponsored Fetal Personhood Bill, Opposes Family Planning Funds: Despite Mitt... http://t.co/GiqRYmnT #tfb
item.content:encoded: http://t.co/VzYXkXoF Paul Ryan Sponsored Fetal Personhood Bill, Opposes Family Planning Funds: Despite Mitt... http://t.co/GiqRYmnT #tfb Despite Mitt Romney's efforts to court women voters ahead of November, he chose a running mate who is far outside the mainstream on women's health issues. Rep. Paul Ryan (R-Wis.) cosponsored a bill that would give fetuses full personhood rights from the moment of fertilization, which was even rejected by voters in the socially conservative state of Mississippi. Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: huffingtonpost.com

item.title: Rasmussen: Ryan favorability 39/25, 52/29 among … seniors - Hot Air
item.description: Rasmussen: Ryan favorability 39/25, 52/29 among … seniors: Counterintuitive. The media has talke... http://t.co/CCZem4Nj #tcot #tlot #p2
item.content:encoded: Rasmussen: Ryan favorability 39/25, 52/29 among … seniors: Counterintuitive. The media has talke... http://t.co/CCZem4Nj #tcot #tlot #p2 The media has talked about Paul Ryan’s budget as an albatross that would hang from Mitt Romney’s neck with or without Ryan on the ticket, and the assumption has been that Ryan himself will also be a net negative for the GOP in November. Democrats tried to proactively damage Ryan’s standing with voters by depicting him pushing an elderly woman off of a cliff in May 2011, when Ryan first proposed his comprehensive, long-term budget reform package in May 2011. Rasmussen Reports has reminds us that a July survey showed Ryan’s favorability as mainly positive, albeit with a significant number of likely voters who need more time to make up their minds: Link - Trackbacks
item.dc:creator: hotair.com
